comments.commentBody:
Thank you for introducing me to Mr. Sarrazin. Surprisingly, his book 'Germany Abolishes Itself' is not on Amazon or eBay. Considering it was a top seller in Germany five years ago I suspect the long arm of the censor at work.
From what I was able to find about his world view, I think he is an oracle. In fact much of what he predicted is unfolding now.
When I smell soured urine in the street, my first thought is: "someone has been smoking weed."
Seconded! A true New Yorker in more ways than one.

Indeed! Even the reputedly pacifist Buddhists have shown a different side of themselves in Myanmar by slaughtering Hindus.

Though, some would argue that Buddhism isn't even a religion.

Hillary Clinton is worlds away from Trump. The comparison demonstrates you as a non-observer and non-thinker.

I have issues with HRC, but on the whole, her career has been admirable and she has done well. She has courage and backbone.

What she lacks that Trump has, is the promotion of hatred and greed and selfishness.

Interestingly…when the Getty Center was constructed in the 1980’s and 90’s, Brentwood required that not one shovelful of soil leave the site…ostensibly for the same reasons outlined in this article…danger, dirt and general disturbance from trucks. Designers had to painstakingly plan their cutting and filling to redistribute (on the same site) all excavated material.
In a sad irony…that would be funny (ala The Onion) if it weren’t true…2 Beverly Hills police officers have lost their lives in the line of “duty”….not by “thugs” but by trucks leaving “giga-mansions”.

I think you need to look a deeper into this article other than it being of an entertainment value Joe.
Inept, ineffective and possibly corrupt local local government.
Lawyers needing lawyers.
Misuse and abuse of the law.
The attempt to hide money that is generated from questionable and most probably corrupt sources.
US tax dollars (mine & yours) in the form of foreign aid possibly going to corrupt foreign government officials.
Environmental impact. We have had this little drought problem here in Southern California.
Blight.
People have died Joe, including two police officers.

What would $100 million get me in Iowa Joe? Des Moines and would you include Cedar Rapids to sweeten the deal?

May be the rate of rape is actually lower in India.  Good for you--MAY BE--more like reality.  Thank God you didn't say--rape IS lower in India.  Rape is a huge social stigma for the victims in India--the famous N Delhi case where a young woman was raped on a bus, had the patriarchs of the Indian society saying the girl brought it on herself.  True, the young of both genders, protested that rape but the culture remains the same.  The shame is intense, under reporting is a consequence of that shame and this is not India bashing but reality.  America has an appalling number of rapes.  That doesn't mean India stands vindicated--they do it worse in America so what right do the Americans have to wash our dirty linen?  Sounds defensive and juvenile.  An Indian woman and rape victim has documented the tragedy of rapes in India in photos.  The NYT has merely shown her pictorial essay.  What has that got to do with India bashing?  Should the NYT have ignored these pictures or the efforts of the author of the pictures and if so why?  To please you because you don't like what you consider India bashing?

It was not down. I enrolled last night and with some help from one of the supervisors found a very good plan that covered all 7 of my providers, many from different groups. You complainers forget what ACA has done for all of us:  no pre=existing clause, no lifetime limit where a baby could meet its lifetime limit by age two with a heart defect, etc., children covered until age 26, health costs decreased with those who now have insurance instead of emergency room care only. Imagine how much better it could have been if the repubs had actually wanted their constituents to have health coverage and didn't use all their time and our money investigating and re-investigating if they didn't like the answer they got on bipartisan committees.

I want to hear more about this.  What is it about this and our culture that needs to maintain an illusion of happiness, perfection and moral purity.  In the US families also school children to adopt behaviors that reflect highly on the family, was more prevalent in the 50's, but it's extremely difficult now for most families to maintain that, it breaks down fairly quickly, our culture allows children to rebel and speak up for themselves. Generally the most educated children are encouraged to argue with authority and be independent thinkers, it's valued. Why isn't' that valued?  Perhaps the policing and reporting can be done in a more private way to insulate the family from the general gossip of the area? Can they institute policies of anonymity.

You do mean "The War of Northern Aggression", don't you?
"Damn Yankee!" Show me your passport.
Don't you understand "Amarican" when it's spoken to you?
Go back to NYC!
As a Native New Yorker, who has lived in Greer (Pronounced "Grrrrr"), SC these past 37 years, I am not surprised at what was sent you, M. Koechy.
I overheard this in a Sambo's, in Charlotte, NC, decades ago.
What do you consider Yankee states? Anything NORTH of Raleigh.

So, am I to understand that men of a certain socioeconomic strata are incapable of restraining their libido's? I would seem that like most things that happen regularly in society's, murder, rape, mass gun killings, the society in question through it's laws and culture while not actively condoning such behavior, do little to curtail it's occurrence. America is guilty of this as it concerns gun laws. India's traditional patriarchal culture, is guilty of treating their greatest resource, women, as if they have no value.

I check out Ms. Sharma's Kickstarter page. She's asking for $18,000, which in the whole scheme of things is not a lot of money. Perhaps someone in Bollywood would be willing to donate that amount or make up the difference?

I don't disagree that East Asian countries have similar issues but, being Asian myself, solve this problem by starting with yourself (I'm using "you" here not to refer only to you but anyone Asian) and your own family/ circle of friends. I grew up in a family with strong women who did not tolerate disrespect or abuse by men. My mother and aunts through their words and actions, including one who left an abusive marriage, were role models to me in this regard and they taught me to stand up for myself.

I don't think the idea of filial piety is inconsistent with that. What you or some might think equates to "happiness or peacefulness" of the parents may not be in truth what those parents really think. I would wager a fair number of Asian parents, just like non-Asian parents, are concerned with the health, well-being, and happiness of their children and would not want them to suffer in silence.

I too was a rape victum in 1970.   People I fear still do not truly realize the life long toll this takes on the victim, you simply dont get over it. And worse still in these communities in India so well documented here these girls and women will be stymied for life.  Patriarchal societies where virginity is prized becomes a tool of destruction and revenge.  Innocent young women who already will always be lower status suffer profoundly.  I am totally sickened by this on going tradgedy in India.

Firstly, when rape isn't reported because victims are shamed, of course your rate is lower. It doesn't mean there is less actual rape. Second, and it is not a logical thought that rape is something that only happens to upper class or middle class women. And this article makes it very clear that much of the problem happens in poor and rural communities (hence the fixes of indoor toilets and bicycles). If one lives in poverty, why should one also live in fear of getting raped?  The idea that rape is somehow a lesser problem than poverty is so tone deaf well you cast aspersions upon yourself just by saying it. Who would think such a thing?

The reason that the official "rape rate" is low in India is because SO FEW ARE REPORTED.  Why wouldn't you keep uour mouth shut?  The consequenses of the crime may be even more horrific than the assault.  DUH.

Your talk about the gap between the rich and the poor, the lack of availability of bail or defense attorneys for the perpetrators or the accused, open defecation and no public toilets, no proper transportation for school kids in rural areas are well taken.  But the photo essay, if you saw it, addresses some of those problems.  It suggests better indoor plumbing for the poor so that girls don't have to go into the bushes after dark to urinate, it talks of bicycles for girls to get to school, so that they don't have to walk long distances to get to school.  Protesting, I believe you are saying, is fashionable and the upper caste and the privileged do it but the lower caste and the poor are the prime victims of the rape culture and neither are they included in the protests, to top it off they are treated by the protesters as lowly inconveniences while the protests should be about them and should be inclusive.  Many truths in what you say, but it is the upper classes who occupy positions of power and they must change the tenor and content of the law.  There should be better laws, there should be strict enforcement, the poor must be educated about their rights in the case of rape, caste based rapes should be treated as hate crimes and hate crimes should be written into the law and slated for more punitive damage, defense attorneys and doctors should be given sensitivity training and told there will be repercussions for not following the law--Herculean.  Cause de jure-- a start.

I wholeheartedly appreciate the commendable job done by Smita Sharma. Rapists should be treated as one of the worst criminals both by the society and by the courts. They should be meted out severest punishment without delay in addition to shaming them publicly. I go to the extent of suggesting castration of the rapists so that other criminals should think at least a thousand times before committing such heinous crimes.

Courts should never force the victims to marry the rapists since they seldom change. The rapists in turn might compel their wives to indulge in prostitution thereby making their lives further miserable. Courts must show proper way to those unfortunate victims so that they can lead rest of their lives in peace and in proper safety.

I'm a medical physicist and do X-ray shielding for a living.  Dr. Kinane's is correct that the link between dental X-rays and brain cancer is very questionable.  However, he is wrong to assume that X-ray personnel would show increased brain cancer incidents before patients would.
Perhaps looking for a dental college that would treat you would be more financially feasible.

I have always had problems with my teeth, including numerous root canals beginning at age 11, at least ten crowns, and one implant. My dental care in childhood was almost nonexistent, which has resulted in lifelong problems. I go for twice yearly cleaning and exams now, and my dentist finds decay at early stages, but he has never found anything with an x-ray that he did not already know was a problem. But I have had multiple meningiomas - the brain tumors that may be linked to x-rays. I too question the use of routine x-rays - and I have not been blessed with good teeth.

Most civilized men would never do such a thing, only an ungodly beast. Men are supposed to protect women, not harm them. These are messed up and defective men.

It should be taught to boys and men that such behavior is very wrong by their parents, and encourage them to support women and not allow these things to happen, whether on a college campus or somewhere else.

My grandma once gave me good advice to avoid unnecessary costs in life: Don't ask a barber if you need a haircut.

She would likely have added: Don't ask the Dean of the Barber School either.

Joe

Goldstien... your comments on here are really unfortunate. It gives people a sense of false security in their own health. I am glad that you, so far, do not have any issues. My parents woudl completely disagree. they have brushed, flossed but skipped the dentist for years... now they are suffering. My post above was in relation to their own experience. They had a huge emergency room visit cost for being suborn and cheap. If they were in getting x-rays they woudl have seen that there was tumor on my Dad's jaw. No he has never smoked or chewed. So ya... get x-rays, don't be cheap with your help and don't imprint your opinions on others in a way that could cause them harm. You would never tell a 50 year old man not to get his prostate checked, right? Even though he says he never had a problem. Very short sighted approach and one I hope doesn't catch up to you like my Dad.

What infuriated me was that I had made the appointment in good faith, I was quite clear about what I wanted and didn't want, and I was already in the chair.  I had also been a patient there for over twenty years.  If they had given me the cleaning, but said xrays would be required before any future cleaning I would have grudgingly accepted it, but to pull a bait and switch on me after I was in the chair was totally unacceptable.  I have gone to another dental practice since then and as I expected they imposed the full dog and pony show of procedures on me as a new patient.  That would have been fine except I didn't like the practice so I still need to find another dentist who will, of course, expect me to submit to all of the same wallet draining procedures even though it has been decades since I've needed anything other than a cleaning.

I don't think it is true at all that cavities decrease as you get older. As you age, your tooth enamel wears, your gums recede, your mouth produces less saliva, and you are prone to numerous conditions (and medications) that can negatively impact dental health. The majority of people over 50 have root decay in their teeth. Remember, too, that these days, more and more people are keeping their natural teeth as they age, largely because of improved dental care, access to care, and nutrition.

Knowing that x-rays are ionizing (the cause of their cancer initiation) I always take a double dose of Vitamin C + Vitamin E about an hour before my appointment if I know they will be doing x-rays. This is in the hopes of quickly neutralizing any free radicals that are created by the x-rays. No idea if it works but it can't hurt.
